results.title: Pride and prejudice
results.creator_credit: Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, Hunt Stromberg and Robert Z Leonard
results.brief_description: Five marriageable daughters! What’s a mother to do? What’s a father to do? What are we to do? Laugh, cry and become totally entranced by “Pride and Prejudice”, Jane Austen’s classic comedy of manners. Adapted for the screen by Aldous Huxley, this energetic film stars Greer Garson and Laurence Olivier. Also starring are Edmund Gwenn, Mary Boland, Maureen O’Sullivan and Ann Rutherford. The beautiful costumes are by renown designer Adrian.

results.title: Prick up your ears
results.creator_credit: Civilhand Zenith, Andrew Brown and Stephen Frears
results.brief_description: Gary Oldman plays Joe Orton, the enfant-terrible of English drama, a working-class Leicester lad who electrified and scandalized Londoners in the early 1960s with plays such as “Loot” and “Entertaining Mr Sloan”. Based on the biography of Orton by John Lahr (played in the film by Wallace Shawn), “Prick Up Your Ears” is a confronting and unsentimental examination of the tormented love relationship between Orton and his less successful, less charismatic lover, Kenneth Halliwell (played by Alfred Molina). The attractive and witty Orton uses his art and his life to confront the bourgeois class values of the English theatrical establishment, as well as mocking their hypocritical conservative sexual morality. His commitment to sexual promiscuity, as well as the meteoric nature of his success, enrages the shy Halliwell who can only respond with paranoid and violent behaviour. But in amongst the very serious questions the film raises about class, sexuality and violence, it also paints a convincing and colourful portrait of the beginnings of “swinging London” in the sixties. Orton and Halliwell’s milieu is one shared by Twiggy, the Beatles, and an assortment of artists and celebrities who work in repressed England, but who also holiday and cut loose in the sunshine (and cheap sex and drugs) afforded by the Mediterranean. Sharp, brutal and satirically unflattering about the English stage, “Prick Up Your Ears” is scripted by Alan Bennett and includes outstanding performances by Oldman, Molina, Vanessa Redgrave and Julie Walters.

results.title: Pretty in pink
results.creator_credit: Paramount Pictures, Lauren Shuler and Howard Deutch
results.brief_description: Andie (Molly Ringwald) is a girl of modest means, who may have to suffer the humiliation of having no date for the prom. She just wants to express herself through her eccentric fashion sense, but this does not sit well with her peers at the snob-ridden local high school. Pretty in Pink’ is a classic80s “teen flick”, which, to quote Adrian Martin, “sensitizes us to all that is modest, fleeting, fragile in popular cinema and popular culture”. Cast includes Molly Ringwald, Andrew McCarthy and Jon Cryer.

results.title: Power and terror: Noam Chomsky in our times
results.brief_description: A series of lectures by eminent American expert on foreign policy, Noam Chomsky, are centred around the issues of September 11 - the United States’ response to the disaster, as well as the Government’s participation in terrorism. Chomsky displays his signature articulation and intelligence in these illuminating pieces, providing a complex picture of world politics. He deftly places the terrorist attacks in the context of American foreign intervention throughout the decades: for example in Vietnam, Central America and the Middle East. In stark and uncompromising terms Chomsky presents his views that challenge widely held perceptions about America’s motivations, in a refreshingly composed and astute way. Some lectures include question and answer forums with the audience.

results.title: Powder
results.creator_credit: Hollywood Pictures, Caravan Pictures, Roger Birnbaum, Daniel Grodnik and Victor Salva
results.brief_description: A sci-fi film about a 16-year-old albino boy who, having spent all his life living in his grandparents basement until their passing away, suddenly finds himself in a totally foreign environment when he is removed from his home and placed into school. Jeremy Reed (Sean Patrick Flanery) nick-named Powder, has special powers but his strange physical appearance and behaviour causes division within the school and the community with bigotry and hatred on one side and respect and friendship on the other. An unusual modern day fable. Cast includes Mary Steenburgen, Lance Henriksen, Jeff Goldblum.

results.title: Post coitum = Animal triste
results.creator_credit: Ognon Pictures, Pinou Film, Humbert Balsan and Brigitte Rouan
results.brief_description: Director Brigitte Rouan (in a brave move), casts herself as Diane Clovier, a happily married career woman who falls passionately in love with a man twenty years younger than herself, Emilio (Boris Tegal). She begins an affair with him, and is debilitated by the ensuing desire and love that consumes them while they’re together. Emilio accompanies Diane to Prague where she threatens to ruin her professional reputation by putting her desires before work. Diane’s affair is blatantly obvious to her husband, Phillipe (Patrick Chesnais), however he tacitly lets the affair continue in the hope that it will soon end. When he is employed as the defence lawyer for Madame Dupleche who has been charged with murdering an abusive, unfaithful husband, it causes him, as well as Diane, to question the situation they find themselves in and to discover what makes them happy. Cast includes Boris Terral, Nils Tavernier and Patrick Chesnais. In French with English subtitles.

results.title: Popeye
results.creator_credit: Paramount Pictures, Robert Evans and Robert Altman
results.brief_description: The comic strip and animated sailor hero with a thing for spinach comes to life in this meticulous live action kids film. Director Robert Altman traces the origins of Popeye, his battle against arch-rival Bluto and his budding romance with Olive Oyl. Cast includes Robin Williams, Shelley Duvall, Ray Walston, Paul L. Smith, Paul Dooley.

results.title: Pollyanna
results.brief_description: Adapted from the popular story by Eleanor Parker. Pollyanna (Hayley Mills) glows as the little orphan girl who believes that “things are always better than they seem”. She manages to change the heart of an entire town including her Aunt Polly (Jane Wyman). Judged by the public and critics alike as one of Walt Disney’s finest achievements. Pollyanna is a celebration of life. Rated G.

results.title: Police Story 3: Super Cop
results.creator_credit: Golden Harvest, Golden Way, Leonard Ho, Raymond Chow and Stanley Tong
results.brief_description: Jackie Chan is the maverick cop Ka Kui who goes undercover to investigate covert arms and drug deals between mainland China and Hong Kong. Michelle Yeoh plays his partner Yeung and together they embark on an action-packed adventure which is full of amazing stunts and daredevil feats.

constellations_other.name: Jason Phu and genre-bending kung fu films
constellations_other.description: Analects of Kung Phu work is a philosophical guide to life via martial arts films, drawing on his interest in Vietnamese and Chinese folklore, which inspires many of the films featured in this Constellation.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Golden Harvest, Golden Way, Leonard Ho, Raymond Chow and Stanley Tong
results.description: Chan Kong-sang, or as westerners know him, “Jackie Chan”, is the maverick cop Ka Kui who goes undercover to investigate covert arms and drug deals between mainland China and Hong Kong. Michelle Yeoh plays his partner Yeung and together they embark on an action-packed adventure which is full of amazing stunts and daredevil feats that will leave you on the edge of your seat. In Mandarin with English subtitles.

results.title: Pokemon the first movie: Mewtwo strikes back
results.creator_credit: Pikachu Project '98, 4 Kids Productions, Choji Yoshikawa, Tomoyuki Igarashi, Takemoto Mori, Norman J Grossfeld, Kunihiko Yuyama and Michael Haigney
results.brief_description: Preceding the feature length Pokemon movie is a short animated Pokemon story called “Pikachu’s vacation” which really appears to be void of any substantial plot and is somewhat difficult to follow, particularly as there is not a lot of English narration accompanying the action. However Pokemon fans will no doubt enjoy the visuals and the familiar Japanese anime style of animation. “Pokemon the first movie: Mewtwo strikes back” questions several of todays moral and ethical dilemmas including cloning. The story begins with the birth of Mewtwo, a bio-engineered Pokemon created from the DNA of Mew, the rarest of all Pokemon. On discovering that he has been created for reseach purposes, Mewtwo becomes angry, breaking out of captivity. His mission is to eliminate all Pokemon and humans and let super clones rule the world. It is up to Ash Ketchum to save Earth, along with his human and Pokemon friends, including Pikachu. A battle like never before takes place, with original Pokemon fighting super clone Pokemon, Mewtwo fighting Mew, and Ash valiantly trying to put an end to the fighting. Themes such as friendship, loyalty, and non-violence are expounded and yet visually in terms of the fighting, the opposite takes place until near the very end of the story. Created by Satoshi Tajiri, written by Takeshi Shudo, with English adaptation directed by Michael Haigney. Dubbed in English. See also www.pokemonthemovie.com.
